Sweden: The Thirty Years' War ends, with Sweden among the winners. The Peace of Westphalia grants Sweden the provinces of Western Pomerania, Wismar, and the bishoprics of Bremen-Verden.
Spain: The Treaty of Westphalia was signed.
Russia: Khmelnytsky Uprising: A Polish szlachta, Bohdan Khmelnytsky, leads the Cossacks of the Zaporizhian Sich against the Polish Crown.
Salt Riot: Upset over the introduction of a salt tax, the townspeople launched a rebellion in Moscow.
Salt Riot: A group of nobles demanded a zemsky sobor on behalf of the rebellion.
Salt Riot: Many of the rebellion's leaders were executed.
Khmelnytsky Uprising: Khmelnytsky entered the Ukrainian capital, Kiev.
Poland: Election of John II Casimir Vasa
Germany: Thirty Years' War: The Peace of Westphalia was concluded, ending the war and granting Switzerland and the Netherlands independence from the Holy Roman Empire.
France: Fronde: Cardinal Mazarin ordered the arrest of the leaders of the parlement of Paris, which provoked widespread rioting.
Thirty Years' War: The Peace of Westphalia ended the war with France obtaining the better bargain, and annexing eastern territories.
Brazil: First Battle of Guararapes: the Portuguese army defeats the Dutch army in the northeast of Brazil.
Belgium: Peace of Münster ends the war with the Dutch Republic.
